page.title: 02BECKLEY VILLAGE 1985
page.content: Beckley is a small village about five miles to the N.E. of Oxford. It is on a hillside overlooking Otmoor, a low lying, wet area. A village was here in Saxon times and the Romans once built a road over Otmoor and through Beckley. A modern row of old people's bungalows is called Roman Way. The oldest building in Beckley is the church which dates from Norman times. The church tower can be seen as you approach the village. One other landmark is the 550 feet television and radio mast. This transmits all four television channels and radio programmes. The old village is very picturesque with stone cottages covered with roses. Modern bungalows and houses along the Woodperry Road opposite the village playing field enjoy fine views across Otmoor.
